name: Plumwood Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have little to add to all the other positive reviews that have been written about this place. The room, the pools, the staff, the location, everything was first-class. I just regretted that we could not stay longer.
reviews.title: Great guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great guesthouse very near to the high street and all the restaurants. It is set over two houses with two small pools in a courtyard in between. Our room was one of the smaller ones but was more than sufficient for us with a fantastic bathroom. The whole place is very well done out and the staff are really friendly.
reviews.title: Great guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovley B&B just walking distance from the main street in Franschhoek.
reviews.title: Great B&B in centre of Franschhoek
Beautiful place in a beautiful town
reviews.text: Very friendly owners, and a choice of 2 pools.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could only book a standard room, which was a little on the small side, but had huge ceilings, and fitted out to a very high standard. The bathroom was the best on our whole trip.
reviews.title: Fabulous Franschhoek!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: Great place in town. Lovely pool and helpful service to book restaurants, etc. Only don't ask for an iron as they don't have any for the guests! Suggest booking the more popular eateries 2 weeks in advance.
reviews.title: really lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a real nice place to stay. We had fun, enjoyed our meal with Roel and Lucienne and enjoyed the area. Roel knows the best restaurants and places to go. Our room was great, just everything about the place was good. I don't really want to say how good it is because I want to be able to get in next time.
reviews.title: real nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most wonderful guesthouse ever stayed in. You can see that the owners really love what they are doing: everything is done with attention to detail. We stayed for their dinner evening once and that was really special, we were 8 people at the same table, and we got along very well. We had a great evening with wonderful food and wines. Owners were joining us for dinner.
reviews.title: A real Gem...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pool area is great, you don't want to leave, and the breakfast is a large buffet with all home made goodies. They even make their own marmalades and chocolate banana bread, MMMM. We will return, in fact, we have already booked our room for next year!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We sadly only spent a couple of days in Franschoek, but we are already planning to return.
reviews.title: wonderfull place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this guesthouse on spec (it was low season) and they had rooms available. They gave us a discount on this as we were last minute. We stayed for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: The rooms were really good quality. Large rooms and large beds, well serviced with lights, big tv with regional channels, wireless internet access and a big safe (we had some camera equipment we wanted to lock away). The bathrooms were modern and new. Clean tiled floor to ceiling with stone and walk-in massage shower. Underfloor heating and heated towel rails. The communal areas were lovely too with big fireplace and comfy seats.
reviews.title: extremely good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I used their laundry service to get a few shirts cleaned as we'd been travelling for nearly 3 weeks, and they came back perfect.
reviews.title: Excellant location and accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners were really helpful and organised a driver for visiting vineyards for us, and booked restaurants for us in the evening.
reviews.title: First class service
Wonderful setting
reviews.text: The location was great, we could walk to everywhere in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is honestly the best place we ever stayed in, and we do travel a lot. You can not believe how well appointed the rooms are, with beautiful luxurious soaps, bathsalts etc. Breakfast is a feast every day. We had the most amazing view from our balcony. Had dinner there one evening with some other guests as well and we had a great time. It was like having dinner with good friends. Raoel and Lucienne really make an effort to make everyody feel at home and comfortable. We will come back here. You need to book early here as they are far in advance booked up.
reviews.title: Best place we ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great place to spend time in Franschhoek!! We spent two wonderful days at the Plumwood. Great location, wonderful staff (booked restaurants and wine tours for us) and a great feel about the place. The rooms are a little small but with very impressive decor. I'd have not problems recommending this guest house.
reviews.title: The wonderful Plumwood!
Stunning!
reviews.text: This place is absolutely gorgeous! It is tastefully and luxuriously furnished, the service is attentive without being overbearing and the location is fantastic.

reviews.title: Fabulous Guesthouse
reviews.text: As a group of 6 we had the 3 rooms in the second building which was brilliant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Franschhoek is a lovely little town full of great restaurants and close to loads of great vineyards. Took a trip to Stellenbosch which was nowhere near as pretty or charming.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the front room of the main house - which was both comfortable & luxuriously appointed - with a generously sized bed & quality linen. The bathroom was spotlessly clean & also decorated to a high standard - in fact the shower was one of the best we experienced during our trip - plenty of hot water, excellent pressure, a selection of rooibos toiletries & lots of big white towels - bliss.
reviews.title: Luxurious B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roel & Lucienne were gracious, friendly hosts and really made us feel welcome as we chatted with them over breakfast. The continental breakfast was excellent - served on the verandah of the new villa overlooking the pool area - with lots of nice touches like extra dried fruit & seeds for topping the cereal, proper juice & fresh muffins. (Hot breakfasts are cooked to order but we were in self preservation mode after an 8 course dinner the previous day so stuck to the cereal & toast!)
reviews.title: First Class Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect for wandering into town for dinner, on a quiet side street just off the main road.
reviews.title: You won't find anywhere better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fabulous time at this lovely guesthouse. The owners were very friendly and the staff made us feel very welcome. They recommended some very good restaurants and pre booked them for us. We would definitely go back, and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. Our room was luxurious and very recently refurbished to a high standard.
reviews.title: most wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here. It is really one of the most beautiful and best appointed guesthouses in south africa. The rooms are beautifully decorated, nice toiletteries, wonderful variety at breakfast. Beautiful views and quietly located close to the centre of the village. They prebooked all our dinners. We loved Le Bon Vivant and Reuben, and also the bistro at le Quartier Francais. We had wonderful winetasting at Glenwood which we visited on a rented bike. Also Stoony Brooks was lovely.
reviews.title: Great Base for Food & Wine lovers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We arrived here after leaving La Plume in Oudtshoorn.
reviews.title: Wonderful end to our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our last 2 nights of our holiday and what a wonderful place to finish up in.
reviews.title: Excellent option in a Charming place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is lovely and we had a large bedroom with a large bathroom and a balcony overlooking the pool.
reviews.title: Great place to enjoy the food and wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were wonderful and very helpful and were anxious to make your stay comfortable.
reviews.title: Ideal location

likes.disliked: — room was at entrance gate and could be a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We eat at 2 fantastic restaurants, 1st was Le Quartier Francais at in the tasting room. Expensive but well worth it. The 2nd at Le Bonn Vivant where we had a fantastic meal to end our holiday.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in December 2006. Roel and Lucienne were perfect hosts, looking after our every wish and baking lovely plum cake for breakfast one day. The breakfasts were very good. Our room was very comfortable with a large bathroom. It was all very clean. The Inn itself is a small romantic retreat in the heart of Franschhoek, within easy walking distance of the main street and all the excellent restaurants. We went to a wine tasting at Haute Cabriere 2km away and had lunch at the award winning restaurant - unmissable!
reviews.title: Lovely Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This lovely country guest house is situated within a short stroll of all the fantastic restaurants that this small town has to offer.
reviews.title: A hidden gem...

description: Nestled between towering mountains, met with magnificent vineyards at the slopes, you’ll find the cosy yet romantic retreat of Plumwood Inn. Mornings on the terrace, with full-on alfresco breakfasts, introduces you to a day of adventure filled exploring of the nearby village centre, literally a two minute stroll from the guesthouse, set in a magnificent cosmopolitan atmosphere. Plumwood Inn – a winning formula of great location, comfortable accommodation and genuine hospitality.
